exam.question: In some remote places there are still very poor people who can’t afford to live in ______conditions.

answer.explain: 句意： 在一些偏远的地区， 还有十分贫困的人无法在像样的环境下生活。gracious： 亲切的； honorable： 可敬的； positive： 肯定的。

sentences.sContent: Paul visited the local bars more frequently than was decent for a senior lecturer.
sentences.sCn: 保罗过于频繁地光顾当地酒吧，不太合乎高级讲师的身份。

sentences.sContent: The chairman did the decent thing (= did what people thought he ought to ) and resigned.
sentences.sCn: 主席体面地辞去了职务。

sentences.sContent: ...And graduating doesn’t even provide any guarantee of a decent job: six in ten graduates today are in non-graduate jobs...
...for certificates do play a vital role when students look for a decent job...

synos.tran: 正派的；得体的；相当好的

remMethod.val: de(离开) ＋ cent(分币) → 离开分币， 不计较钱 → 大方的

words.tran: 合适地；高雅地；正派地；亲切地
正派；体面；庄重；合乎礼仪；礼貌

trans.tranCn: 像样的， 过得去的， 体面的； 宽厚的， 大方的； 正派的； 合乎礼仪的， 得体的
trans.tranOther: following moral standards that are acceptable to society
